kmail

Class Filter

  • java.lang.Object
    • kmail.Filter

  • public class Filter
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a flag name and a list of keywords that. If a piece of text contains any of the keywords, then the flag name would be applied to the text.
    Author:
    Kelsey McKenna

      • trim

        private static java.lang.String[] trim(java.lang.String[] arr)
        Parameters:
        arr - the array of strings to be trimmed
        Returns:
        a list of trimmed strings, i.e. strings with no leading or trailing spaces.

        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • parse

        public static Filter parse(java.lang.String filter)
        Returns the filter associated with the string. E.g. parse("spam: lucky winner, x factor") would return a filter with the flag name "spam" and keywords {"lucky winner", "x factor"}. Strict formatting is checked. There must be a space after the colon and after each comma. There must be at least one keyword
        Parameters:
        filter -
        Returns:
